intro: Atelophragma elegans, commonly known as the elegant rock orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, hairy stem and a single, showy orchid-like flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or reddish streaks. Atelophragma elegans is a rare and specialized species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
